title: Design’s new frontier
text: Mechanical engineers are using cutting-edge computing techniques to re-imagine how the products, systems, and infrastructures we use are designed.

title: MIT Lincoln Laboratory wins nine R&D 100 Awards for 2021
text: A life-detecting radar, a microscale motor, and a quantum network architecture are among this year's most innovative new technologies.

title: Dexterous robotic hands manipulate thousands of objects with ease
text: Model-free framework reorients over 2,000 diverse objects with a hand facing both upward and downward, in a step toward more human-like manipulation.

title: Toward speech recognition for uncommon spoken languages
text: Reducing the complexity of a powerful machine-learning model may help level the playing field for automatic speech-recognition around the world.

title: 3 Questions: Blending computing with other disciplines at MIT
text: The Common Ground for Computing Education is facilitating collaborations to develop new classes for students to pursue computational knowledge within the context of their fields of interest.

title: Avoiding shortcut solutions in artificial intelligence
text: A new method forces a machine learning model to focus on more data when learning a task, which leads to more reliable predictions.

title: Taming the data deluge
text: A National Science Foundation-funded team will use artificial intelligence to speed up discoveries in physics, astronomy, and neuroscience.

title: Making machine learning more useful to high-stakes decision makers
text: A visual analytics tool helps child welfare specialists understand machine learning predictions that can assist them in screening cases.

title: Artificial intelligence sheds light on how the brain processes language
text: Neuroscientists find the internal workings of next-word prediction models resemble those of language-processing centers in the brain.

title: Saving seaweed with machine learning
text: PhD candidate Charlene Xia is developing a low-cost system to monitor the microbiome of seaweed farms and identify diseases before they spread.

title: One giant leap for the mini cheetah
text: A new control system, demonstrated using MIT’s robotic mini cheetah, enables four-legged robots to jump across uneven terrain in real-time.

title: Artificial networks learn to smell like the brain
text: When asked to classify odors, artificial neural networks adopt a structure that closely resembles that of the brain’s olfactory circuitry.

title: Putting artificial intelligence at the heart of health care — with help from MIT
text: Cardiologist Demilade Adedinsewo is using her MIT Professional Education experience to advance cardiovascular care at the Mayo Clinic.

title: Accelerating the discovery of new materials for 3D printing
text: A new machine-learning system costs less, generates less waste, and can be more innovative than manual discovery methods.

title: These neural networks know what they’re doing
text: A certain type of artificial intelligence agent can learn the cause-and-effect basis of a navigation task during training.
